00035 digit_t inverse0(const integer& n) {
00036     // Using the Dussé and Kalisk simplification
00037     doubledigit_t x = 2, y = 1;
00038     digit_t n0 = n._get_digit(0);
00039     for (size_t i = 2; i <= bits_per_digit; ++i, x <<= 1)
00040         if (x < ((n0 * y) & ((x << 1) - 1)))
00041             y += x;
00042     return digit_t(x - y);
00043 }
00044 
00048 integer montgomeryR(const integer& n) {
00049     return integer::one() << (bits_per_digit * n._get_data()->mLength);
00050 }
00051 
00053 integer toMontgomeryForm(const integer& n, const integer& m) {
00054     return (n * montgomeryR(m) % m);
00055 }
00056 
00058 integer fromMontgomeryForm(const integer& n, const integer& m) {
00059     integer inv=invmod(montgomeryR(m), m);
00060     return (n * inv % m);
00061 }

00086 
00090 integer montgomeryMultiplyMod(const integer& a, const integer& b, const integer&
00091     n, digit_t nPrime0)
00092 {
00093     // Using the Dussé and Kalisk simplification
00094     // Unstated parameter B is a power of two representing the number of values
00095     //   that a single digit can hold, i.e. digit_overflowbit
00096     // Unstated parameter L is the number of digits in the modulus, i.e.
00097     //   n._get_length()
00098     // Unstated parameter r is B^L
00099     // nPrime0 is nPrime mod B, or digit zero of nPrime
00100 
00101     const integer B(digit_overflowbit);
00102     const size_t L(n._get_length()), L1(L-1);
00103 
00104     integer t=a*b;
00105     size_t i=0;
00106 
00107     do {
00108         digit_t mi=digit_t(doubledigit_t(t._get_digit(i))*nPrime0);
00109         t += (n * mi) << (bits_per_digit * i);
00110     } while (++i <= L1);
00111 
00112     t >>= (bits_per_digit * L); // Fast divide by r
00113     return (t >= n ? t - n : t);
00114 }
00115 
00116 namespace {
00117 
00118 // cMaxK sets the balance between memory/precalculations required and the number
00119 // of calculations required for an exponentiation. Increasing it can only reduce
00120 // the calculations by a small amount, whereas it increases the memory
00121 // requirements and number of precalculations by an exponential amount. 8
00122 // provides a good balance.
00123 const size_t cMaxK=8;
00124 typedef boost::uint_t<cMaxK>::fast kbitdigit_t; // k bits have to fit into it
00125 typedef std::vector<kbitdigit_t> vkbitdigit_t;
00126 typedef std::vector<integer> vxint_t;
00127 #define ddPowerOfTwo(p) (doubledigit_t(1) << p)
00128 
00129 // The splitIntoKBitDigits function assumes that cMaxK <= bits_per_digit+1,
00130 // it won't work properly if it isn't.
00131 BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(cMaxK <= bits_per_digit+1);
00132 
00133 class TUTable {
00134     public:
00135     typedef std::pair<int, int> value_t;
00136 
00137     const value_t& operator[](size_t x) const { return mTable[x]; }
00138 
00139     static const TUTable& get() {
00140         // Construct a singleton instance on demand
00141         if (mPtr.get()==0) mPtr.reset(new TUTable);
00142         return *mPtr;
00143     }
00144 
00145     private:
00146     TUTable(): mTable(new value_t[ddPowerOfTwo(cMaxK)]) {
00147         value_t *p=&mTable[0], *pe=p+ddPowerOfTwo(cMaxK);
00148         *p++=std::make_pair(0, 0);
00149         int i=1;
00150         while (p!=pe) *p++=calculateValues(i++);
00151     }
00152 
00153     std::pair<int, int> calculateValues(int x) {
00154         int r=0;
00155         while (1) {
00156             if (x & 0x01) return std::make_pair(r, x);
00157             ++r;
00158             x >>= 1;
00159         }
00160     }
00161 
00162     static std::auto_ptr<TUTable> mPtr;
00163 
00164     boost::scoped_array<value_t> mTable;
00165 };
00166 
00167 std::auto_ptr<TUTable> TUTable::mPtr;
00168 
00169 int mostEfficientK(const integer& e) {
00170     doubledigit_t k=cMaxK, kTarget=log2(e)-1;
00171     while (k > 1 && ((k - 1) * (k << ((k - 1) << 1))
00172         / (ddPowerOfTwo(k) - k - 1)) >= kTarget)
00173             --k;
00174     return int(k);
00175 }
00176 
00177 vxint_t precalculateOddPowersOfAa(const integer& a, const integer&
00178     r, const integer& n, size_t k)
00179 {
00180     integer aa=a*r%n, aSquared=a*a%n;
00181 
00182     vxint_t rval;
00183     rval.reserve(size_t(ddPowerOfTwo(k)));
00184     rval.push_back(integer::one());     // Anything to the zeroth power is one
00185     rval.push_back(aa);                 // Anything to the first power is itself
00186 
00187     for (doubledigit_t i=3, ie=(ddPowerOfTwo(k)); i<ie; i+=2) {
00188         aa=aa*aSquared%n;
00189         rval.push_back(integer::zero()); // Even powers not needed or calculated
00190         rval.push_back(aa);              // Odd power
00191     }
00192 
00193     return rval;
00194 }
00195 
00196 vkbitdigit_t splitIntoKBitDigits(const integer& e, size_t k) {
00197     size_t eBits=log2(e), eDigits=(eBits+k-1)/k, i=0, bitsInHopper=0;
00198 
00199     vkbitdigit_t rval;
00200     rval.reserve(eDigits);
00201 
00202     doubledigit_t hopper=0, mask=(doubledigit_t(1)<<k)-1;
00203     while (eDigits-- > 0) {
00204         if (bitsInHopper < k && i < e._get_length()) {
00205             // Add more bits to the hopper
00206             hopper = hopper | (doubledigit_t(e._get_digit(i++)) << bitsInHopper);
00207             bitsInHopper += bits_per_digit;
00208         }
00209 
00210         // Grab k bits off the bottom
00211         if (bitsInHopper > 0) {
00212             rval.push_back(kbitdigit_t(hopper & mask));
00213             hopper >>= k;
00214             bitsInHopper-=k;
00215         } else {
00216             rval.push_back(0);
00217         }
00218     }
00219 
00220     return rval;
00221 }
00222 
00223 } // namespace
00224 
00228 integer montgomeryPowerMod(const integer& a, const integer& e, const integer& n)
00229 {
00230     // 0 <= a < n, n is odd
00231     // Returns a^e mod n
00232 
00233     const TUTable &tuTable(TUTable::get());
00234 
00235     if (e.sign()==0) return integer::one();
00236     if (n.even()) throw invalid_modulus("montgomeryPowerMod requires an odd "
00237         "modulus");
00238 
00239     // Precalculate some values
00240     const size_t k(mostEfficientK(e));
00241     const integer r(montgomeryR(n));
00242     const digit_t nPrime0(inverse0(n));
00243     const vxint_t oddPowersOfAa(precalculateOddPowersOfAa(a, r, n, k));
00244 
00245     // Slice the exponent (e) up into k-bit digits
00246     vkbitdigit_t eDigits(splitIntoKBitDigits(e, k));
00247 
00248     integer pp;
00249 
00250     kbitdigit_t i=eDigits.back();
00251     eDigits.pop_back();
00252     if (i == 0) {
00253         pp=r%n;
00254     } else {
00255         std::pair<int, int> tu=tuTable[i];
00256         pp=oddPowersOfAa[tu.second];
00257         while (tu.first-- > 0) pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, pp, n, nPrime0);
00258     }
00259 
00260     while (!eDigits.empty()) {
00261         i=eDigits.back();
00262         eDigits.pop_back();
00263 
00264         if (i == 0) {
00265             int t=int(k);
00266             while (t-- > 0) pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, pp, n, nPrime0);
00267         } else {
00268             std::pair<int, int> tu=tuTable[i];
00269 
00270             size_t s=k-tu.first;
00271             while (s-- > 0) pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, pp, n, nPrime0);
00272 
00273             pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, oddPowersOfAa[tu.second], n, nPrime0);
00274 
00275             while (tu.first-- > 0) pp=montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, pp, n, nPrime0);
00276         }
00277     }
00278 
00279     return montgomeryMultiplyMod(pp, integer::one(), n, nPrime0);
00280 }
